intro: Hedyotis santapaui, commonly known as the Peruvian bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers and slender, creeping stems. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Hedyotis santapaui is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
